Prerequisite 2: "Taxes" enabled and at least two taxes different from default available. 1. Open the Expensify app. 2. Navigate to "Workspaces" > "Rules" > "Add Merchant Rule" 3. In "For expenses with", add any merchant. 4. In "Apply these updates", add any category, a description and a tax that is different from the default one. 5. Save the rule. 6. Navigate to workspace chat. 7. Start a manual expense creation flow. 8. Add an amount and tap on "Next" 9. Add the same merchant from step 3. 10. Select a category different from the one on created rule and also a different description. 11. Navigate to "Tax" field and select a rate that is different as the one selected on the created rule, and also different from the default one. 12. Finish the expense creation flow. 13. Open the report of the just created expense. 14. Note that "Category" and "Description" fields, show the information added manually while creating expense. 15. Note that tax rate selected manually, was not retained. ## Expected Result: Created rules should not override the fields that were selected manually by the user while creating expense. ## Actual Result: Tax rate selected manually while creating an expense, is not retained if a rule was created before. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/56e10e7b-9a17-49c8-a1c1-24e0644bbc57 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Duplicate the workspace 10.Open rules 11. Go online 12. Note merchant deleted is cleared 13. Go offline 14. Note merchant deleted is shown in strike through again 15. User A is configured to submit expenses to Approver B in the workflow 2. User A submits an expense report in New Expensify 3. The report is automatically routed to Approver C, without showing any option to select a different approver 4. When opening the same report in Expensify Classic: The report appears as “Outstanding”, waiting for second approver approval 5. There is also an “Add Expenses” button visible ## Expected Result: The report should route to the approver configured in the workflow (Approver B). Once submitted and pending approval: The report should not allow adding expenses (if submission locks the report per workflow). Report state should be consistent between New Expensify and Classic. ## Actual Result: The report routes to Approver C instead of the configured approver. No option is presented to select or override approver. In Classic: Report shows as “Outstanding” (awaiting second approval). “Add Expenses” button is still available despite submission. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos The screenshots and video for the issue are in Slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1771592738132239) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
